# -1 Headings
how to give headings in markdown
# HEADING 1
## Heading 2
### Heading 3
#### heading 4
##### heading 5
###### heading 6
####### so on.....heading sizes ar from 1 - 6

# -2 Block Of Words

This is a normal text in markdown

>This is a block of speical text in markdown

# 3- Line Breaks
This is a 40 days long course Data Science with Python AKA python ka Chilla with baba Aamaar. 
This  is second line

To start new line from from new line,\
 either double enter or use (\ back slash) 

 #4- Combine two things

 Block of words and heading

 >## Heading 2 (block of code + heading 2)

 # 5- Face of Text
 Bold **BOLD**
 Italic *Italic*
 Bold and Italic ***Bold and Italic***

 _(UNDERSCORE)
 __BOLD__ 2 times
 _ITALIC_ 1 time

# 6- BULLET POINT / LIST

- Day 1
- Day 2
- Day 3
- Day 4
- Day 5
    - a
    - b
    -c
* Day 6

# Numbering of Lists
1. day1
2. day2
3. day3
4. day4
    * day 4a
    * day 4b

5. day5


# Line Break or Page Break

this is line 1

---

this is line 2.
_____________________
this is line 3
***************************

# -Assignment 
> how to comment down a line in markdown?

> Answer is by using"<!---" at the start of any line , and "--->"at the end of any line, you can easily comment that down. (2-- each side only)

online picture 
![oracle](data:image/png;base64,)

# -10 Adding code or code block

to print a string use `print(codanics)`

`print("HELLO CLASS OF AMMAR")`

```python
i = j = [3]
i +=j
print(i, j)
```
```javascrpit
i = j = [3]
i +=j
print(i, j)
```
```C++  #can mention codinglanguage, you are writing code for
i = j = [3]
i +=j
print(i, j)
```
```
```

# using ":" on left side to make text left align
# using ":" on right side to make text right align
# using":" on both sides to make text appear in center
